intro: Pilosella melanophaea, commonly known as the black-leaved pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and leaves that are dark green with a slightly woolly texture. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, forming showy clusters that attract pollinators. Pilosella melanophaea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
